results.headline: With No Regrets, Living Her Life as a Bossa Nova
results.summary_short: In the Chilean film “Gloria,” directed by Sebastián Lelio, a heroine in her late 50s embraces passion and romance.

results.display_title: Aatsinki: The Story of Arctic Cowboys
results.headline: Life’s Rhythms in Finnish Lapland
results.summary_short: “Aatsinki: The Story of Arctic Cowboys” follows two reindeer herders in Finnish Lapland for a year.

results.headline: Staring at You, Staring at Me
results.summary_short: Godfrey Reggio’s brooding “Visitors” peers into humanity’s troubled soul with the help of a sober, churning score by Philip Glass.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Visitors

results.headline: How Love Survives Altered Expectations
results.summary_short: When an Irish husband, father and craftsman suffers a stroke, his family, and an outsider, reflect the changed balance of the household.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Run & Jump

results.display_title: Mercedes Sosa: The Voice of Latin America
results.headline: A Skylark Who Sang Truth to Power in Argentina
results.summary_short: Rodrigo H. Vila’s documentary “Mercedes Sosa: The Voice of Latin America,” looks at a singer who spoke for the oppressed during Argentina’s period of dictatorship.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mercedes Sosa: The Voice of Latin America

results.headline: The Sun Is Setting, but Don’t Let Them Hear You Say That
results.summary_short: “Old Goats,” which was made on a shoestring budget, looks at aging through the eyes of three elderly friends.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Old Goats

results.headline: A Boy Finds a Lost Generation
results.summary_short: “Life Is Strange” is an oral history of displaced European Jews, as survivors recall their childhoods before and during the Holocaust, with narration by a boy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Life Is Strange

results.headline: A Pregnant Teenager Finds Her Way, in Spite of Her Parents
results.summary_short: “Gimme Shelter,” written and directed by Ronald Krauss and based on a true story, follows Apple, a teenager who has a drug-addicted mother and a father who’s not in the picture.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Gimme Shelter

results.headline: In a Teenage Snake Pit, a Chance to Be Trendy
results.summary_short: Every mean girl needs a gay male best friend; at least that’s what the teenagers in “G.B.F.” believe.

results.headline: It’s a Guy Thing
results.summary_short: A photographer who takes what he calls “fetish photos” is the subject of “24 Exposures.”

results.headline: Who’s the Bad Guy Here? It Depends
results.summary_short: In “Enemies Closer,” a park ranger and a disgruntled foe team up to survive an onslaught from a drug runner.

results.headline: Dangerous Undertow in a Cruisers’ Haven
results.summary_short: A stretch of beach and its adjoining woods, which serve as a gay cruising spot, become a crime scene in “Stranger by the Lake,” by the French filmmaker Alain Guiraudie.

results.headline: A Stifled Soul Toughs It Out With At-Home Acts
results.summary_short: “Towheads,” written and directed by and starring Shannon Plumb, focuses on physical comedy as a woman, alienated, tries to keep it all together.

results.headline: She’s Having My Baby, Satan Croons
results.summary_short: “Devil’s Due” centers on a couple who discover they’re expecting a baby after a honeymoon outing that they can’t fully recall. Hmm.

results.display_title: Will You Still Love Me Tomorrow?
results.headline: The New Midlife Crisis
results.summary_short: Arvin Chen’s “Will You Still Love Me Tomorrow?” is a mature story of a married man struggling to stay closeted.

results.headline: Sea, Sky, Spray and a Love Triangle
results.summary_short: “Summer in February,” directed by Christopher Menaul, focuses on a love triangle involving the painter A. J. Munnings at an artists’ colony in Edwardian England.

results.headline: A Teenager Finds Freedom on the Seas
results.summary_short: “Maidentrip” documents Laura Dekker’s journey around the world, sailing alone, at the age of 14.

results.headline: After Old Mistakes, Hard Choices Must Be Made
results.summary_short: Hirokazu Kore-eda’s “Like Father, Like Son” deals with two families who learn that their sons were switched at birth.

results.headline: It’s His Move, This Time on the Right Side of the Law
results.summary_short: “Life of a King” stars Cuba Gooding Jr. as a chess-loving ex-con struggling to rebuild his life.

results.headline: These Criminals Are Throwbacks
results.summary_short: The animated feature “The Nut Job” centers on a gang of humans trying to rob a bank, and a group of squirrels attempting a heist of a nut store.
